H0.text: There would be no seasons if the Earth did not tilt on its axis in relation to the sun.

H1.text: One Earth-year would be 14% longer if the Earth did not tilt on its axis in relation to the sun.

H2.text: The Earth would spin at a different rate if it did not tilt on its axis in relation to the sun.

H3.text: Temperatures at the Earth's equator would cool if the Earth did not tilt on its axis in relation to the sun.

A4.text: the cause of the seasons on Earth.

A5.text: Variations in Earth's axial tilt can influence the seasons.
